|vendor_id = 168c |device_id = 0030 |subvendor_id = 168c |subdevice_id = 3112 |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = TE7WDN4800 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada ID, Leave blank for none --> |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = <!-- OUI -->
|chip1 = Atheros;AR9380; |chip2 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = RP-SMA |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |txchains = 3 |rxchains = 3 |sstreams = 3 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |802.11n = 450 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "2052500306 Rev:1.0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :{{WiFiCert|WFA14671|03/07/2012}}
*Subsystems in the driver include 168c:3112 ([http://forums.techguy.org/linux-unix/1089414-no-wifi-operation-debian-linux.html seems to be the SS used]), :168c:3113, 168c:3114, and 168c:3116.
*[http://pcidatabase.com/vendor_details.php?id=174 ''PCI data base'']: 168c:0030, SS: 10cf:16a8 :Chip Number: PCI\VEN_168C&DEV_0030&SUBSYS_16A810CF&REV_01 :Chip Description: TP-LINK 450Mbps Wireless N Adapter :Notes: [http://www.tp-link.com/en/support/download/?model=TL-WDN4800&version=V1#tbl_a Support page]
